page.title: 08WHITE HOUSE MANOR MUNDON
page.content: {White House Manor}is a 14th century timber framed mansion. It has 21 rooms and it has a large fireplace in the living room which is 6 feet 5 inches in width. They heat the house by gas. One person said "It may have been built by a sheep farmer".The present owners have lived here since about 1980. The house isn't expensive to maintain apart from the heating which costs Â£50 a week. The back garden is two acres and in it is an orchard. As well as that they have a 5 acre field. In the back garden is a big pond where ducks nest. This pond was where the barges turned round when the canal was in use. Outside the house there is a large cannon.
